Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly.

For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI

# EverQuote, Inc. (NASDAQ: EVER) Sell-Side Analysis Report

**Current Stock Metrics** (as of October 11, 2024, close via Yahoo Finance and Nasdaq):
- **Latest Closing Price**: $24.12
- **Market Capitalization**: $716.4 million
- **52-Week Range**: $5.36 - $27.67
- **Avg. Daily Volume (3 months)**: 1.2 million shares
- **P/E Ratio (TTM)**: N/A (recent profitability)
- **Enterprise Value**: $678 million

## Company Overview (High-Level Summary)
EverQuote, Inc. (EVER) operates a digital insurance marketplace platform that connects consumers seeking insurance quotes with a network of agents, carriers, and financial professionals. Founded in 2006 and headquartered in Cambridge, MA, the company leverages data science, machine learning, and proprietary algorithms to match shoppers with personalized insurance options across auto, home & renters, Medicare, life, health, and commercial lines. In 2023, EverQuote facilitated over 20 million quote requests, generating revenue primarily through variable commissions (paid by partners per qualified lead) and fixed fees.

The platform's core value lies in its consumer acquisition expertise, high-intent traffic from SEO, paid search, and TV/digital ads, and a carrier-direct model that bypasses traditional brokers. Auto insurance remains the largest segment (~80% of Q2 2024 variable revenue), but diversification into health/Medicare (up 150% YoY in Q2) and life/health is accelerating. EverQuote went public in 2018 and achieved its first GAAP profitable quarter in Q2 2024 amid a post-pandemic insurance market recovery. With ~450 employees, it competes in the $6B+ U.S. online lead generation sector, emphasizing scalability, shopper conversion (e.g., 20-25% call completion rates), and regulatory compliance (e.g., TCPA). Recent profitability and 74% YoY revenue growth signal a pivot from losses to sustainable expansion, positioning it for multi-year compounding in digital insurance distribution. (Word count: 218)

## Recent Developments
- **Q2 2024 Earnings (Reported August 7, 2024)**: Record revenue of $115.0 million (up 74% YoY from $66.1M); Variable Revenue $111.7M (up 39% YoY, auto up 74%); Gross Margin 83.7%; Net Income $8.1M (first profitable quarter, vs. $28.8M loss prior year); Adjusted EBITDA $11.0M. Q3 Guidance: Revenue $128-132M (up ~37% YoY midpoint).
- **Stock Surge**: Shares up ~300% YTD as of Oct 11, 2024, driven by earnings beat and insurance market softening (lower premiums boosting shopping).
- **September 2024**: Announced expansion of Medicare Advantage capabilities with enhanced quoting tools; CEO noted in investor call "strong Q3 start" amid agent network growth.
- **October 3, 2024**: Participated in Goldman Sachs Communacopia Conference; management reiterated FY2024 revenue guide $408-424M (up ~33% YoY midpoint).
- **Regulatory**: No major issues; compliant with NAIC model laws.

## Growth Strategy
- **Core Pillars**: (1) Deepen auto/home penetration via TV/connected TV ads (e.g., 30%+ shopper growth in auto Q2); (2) Accelerate health/Medicare/life to 30%+ of revenue by 2026 (target: $100M+ annual run-rate); (3) Expand commercial auto/ small business lines; (4) Tech investments in AI matching (e.g., "Shopper Journey Optimization" launched H1 2024).
- **Capital Allocation**: Debt-free balance sheet ($28M cash Q2); prioritizing organic growth over M&A; marketing efficiency improving (CAC stable at ~$100-120 per shopper).
- **Long-Term Targets**: 20-25% CAGR revenue through 2027; EBITDA margins 15-20% by 2026.

## Headwinds and Tailwinds
| Category | Tailwinds | Headwinds |
|----------|-----------|-----------|
| **Company-Specific** | First profitability unlocks investor confidence; agent/carrier network at record 1,000+ partners; data moat (billions of shopper interactions). | Heavy reliance on paid marketing (80% of expenses); past ROAS volatility in soft markets. |
| **Sector (Online Insurance Leads)** | Digital shift (60%+ quotes online by 2025 per McKinsey); falling premiums spur shopping (+15% industry inquiries 2024); Medicare AEP tailwinds (Oct-Dec peak). | Intense competition; carrier consolidation (e.g., Progressive/Geico dominance); regulatory scrutiny on lead quality/data privacy. |
| **Macro** | Lower interest rates aid consumer spending; election-year stability. | Recession risk could cut insurance shopping; ad platform costs (Google/FB) up 10% YoY. |

## Existing Products/Services
- **Auto Insurance Marketplace**: Core (~80% revenue); real-time quotes from 50+ carriers.
- **Home & Renters**: Bundled quoting, 25% attachment rate to auto.
- **Medicare Solutions**: Plan finder for Advantage/Supplement; agent matching (15% of Q2 revenue).
- **Life & Health**: Term/permanent life, individual health plans.
- **Commercial**: Small business auto/workers comp (early stage, <5% revenue).

## New Products/Services/Projects
- **AI-Powered Shopper Matching (Live Q2 2024)**: Boosts conversion 15-20%; tests in health ongoing.
- **Medicare Expansion (H2 2024)**: New "Medicare Navigator" tool for OTC/DSNP plans; partnerships with 20+ new plans.
- **Commercial Lines Rollout (2025)**: Full small business suite (liability/property); pilot Q4 2024.
- **TV Attribution Tech**: Proprietary measurement for CTV ROI, scaling in 2025.

## Market Share and Forecasts
- **Current Approximations** (2023-2024 estimates from Seeking Alpha, company filings, Statista):
  | Segment | EVER Market Share | Notes |
  |---------|-------------------|-------|
  | Auto Leads | 10-15% | Leader among public peers; #2-3 behind undisclosed giants. |
  | Medicare Leads | 5-8% | Rapid gainer post-2023 entry. |
  | Overall Online Insurance | 4-6% | $6B TAM. |
- **Forecast**: +2-4ppt gain in auto/Medicare by 2026 (via network effects); total share to 7-9% (analyst consensus: 25% revenue CAGR supports). Decline risk low unless ad costs spike.

## Competitor Comparison
| Metric (Q2 2024 or Latest) | EVER | QuinStreet (QNST) | SelectQuote (SLQT) |
|----------------------------|------|-------------------|--------------------|
| Revenue YoY Growth | +74% ($115M) | +20% ($138M) | -5% ($350M TTM) |
| Auto Focus | 80% | 60% | 40% (Medicare heavy) |
| Profitability | Net +$8M | EBITDA +$10M | Losses |
| Market Cap | $716M | $1.1B | $1.2B |
| EV/Rev Multiple | 4.1x (fwd) | 5.5x | 0.8x |
- **Edge**: EVER's auto strength + diversification; cheaper valuation vs. QNST.

## Partnerships, M&A, Clients
- **Key Partnerships**: 1,000+ agents/carriers including Progressive, Allstate, Liberty Mutual, Humana (Medicare), eHealth. Recent: Expanded with Geico (Q3 2024).
- **M&A**: None material since 2020 (acquired Zamrunner); cash hoard for tuck-ins.
- **Major Clients**: Top 10 carriers ~50% revenue; potential: UnitedHealth (Optum), Amazon Insurance Services (exploratory).

## Other Qualitative Measures
- **Management**: CEO Jayme Mendler (since 2008) strong track record; insider ownership 15%.
- **ESG**: High data privacy scores; no major lawsuits.
- **Sentiment**: Bullish on X/Reddit/StockTwits (e.g., "auto beast mode" post-earnings); 12 analysts: 100% Buy, avg PT $26.50 (Benchmark $32, Needham $28).
- **Risks**: Seasonality (Q4 Medicare peak); execution on non-auto ramps.

## Investment Recommendation
- **Buy Rating**: **8/10 (Strong Buy)** – Exceptional growth (33%+ FY24 guide), profitability inflection, and undervalued vs. peers (fwd EV/Rev 3.5x vs. sector 6x). Hold/sell only if macro worsens.
- **Estimated Fair Value**: $32 (30% upside) – Based on 20x 2025E EBITDA ($45M est.), DCF with 25% CAGR/12% discount (moderate risk: beta 2.1). Targets strong growth portfolio.
